National Data Management Center (NDMC) is working hard to establish a fellowship program to benefit from the innovative ideas, energy, and state-of-the-art technical knowledge fellows bring.

Well organized and capacitated National Data Management Center (NDMC) will be an asset for Ethiopian Public Health Institute (EPHI) and for Ethiopia at large. NDMC is working hard to establish a fellowship program to benefit from the innovative ideas, energy, and state-of-the-art technical knowledge fellows bring.

Fellows also add to the diversity of workforce by offering a broad set of expertise that complements institution’s existing staff profile. The Fellows obtain a wealth of experience through on-the-job training, rotations, shadowing, and formal training opportunities.

A fellowship gives graduate students the chance to get more graduate and post-graduate research experience without breaking the bank. Organizations usually look for fellows who are high academic achievers, community service leaders, dedicated honors students, and experienced researchers.

Some institution’s like World Bank uses fellowship program to track research, economic policy, technical assistance, and lending operations that contribute to the World Bank’s goal of eliminating poverty and increasing shared prosperity in developing countries.

Africa CDC also uses fellowship to manage event-based surveillance and other public health data and information, including the development and maintenance of a tracking or database tool to log potential leads and follow-up activities and to Support the Incident Management System (IMS) during activation of the Emergency Operations Center.

Thus, aforementioned facts and the benefits that EPHI aim to get from fellowship program impulse to go for fellowship program to add the diversity of workforce by offering a broad set of expertise that complements NDMC existing staff profile.
